TopicTitle: Polar ice caps registering as grasslands?

Articles.Content:
I have landed at the southern pole, near where it starts to get visibly mountainous on the map to do a surveying contract. I figured I'd so some science while there (as I haven't maxed it out) but I'm getting no science points, and the dialogue box lists it as "grasslands' even though I am on a great big blanket of white, with not a blade of grass in sight.

Is this a glitch?

Don't let a few people getting snippy get to you. When you get that kind of answer its generally best to ignore it until someone gives you a legitimate answer, like below.

THe issue in question is caused by how biomes are determined. Biomes are created as a map of a planetary surface that is color coded. The color, as RGB code, is tied to the biome. Sometimes, because of compression, biome borders can register as a biome completely unrelated to either of the two biomes its sandwiched between. One of the most common occurrences is the transition between shores and grasslands on Kerbin. Simply heading west out of the KSC can register you in tundra for a brief minute.

There's also a plateau on Duna where highlands and midlands are mixed up (highlands on the edges, midlands in the middle), but that's not your issue. There may be a mistake on the biome map or you were caught with a fluke in determining biome. Its a known issue and there's actually not much Squad can do about it aside from cleaning up the maps (unless of course they're willing to fully recode how biomes work).
